title: Willakers!! We're in the Wall Street Journal!
body: The Wall Street Journal recently wrote a story about the Oscar-qualifying process that documentaries went through this year. It shook up filmmakers and the Academy, and had the film world (especially independent filmmakers and cinema owners) buzzing for months. The effect of this year's process is still undetermined, but it's been interesting to watch, and to be a participant (of the dozen or so we showed, Meeting Resistance, About a Son, Billy the Kid, The Business of Being Born were just a few of these films). If you're a documentary fan, or are intrigued by the behind-the-scenes exhibition world, then this article is for you. And, oh yeah, we're mentioned in it, too. The article is only available free today, and then you have to pay to read it (unless you're already a savvy news reader and subscribe to the WSJ). Click here for the link. Oh, and what movie is playing on our marquee in that picture? It seems like an awfully long title. Why, I think it says, "The Moxie is the Coolest Theater in Springfield. Hands Down." Well shucks, marquee. *Thanks for Steve Croxton's photographic expertise, and Matt and Kari at Go Magazine for digging up the file photo for the story.
author: Nicole

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
i was gonna say 'awesomeness'
but i guess radness works just as well

comments.author: HonkeyHero
comments.body: Way to go!! Wallstreet loves you!!

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Now you all should read the story...

comments.author: stevie_g
comments.body:
Oh, and what movie is playing on our marquee in that picture? It seems like an awfully long title. Why, I think it says, "The Moxie is the Coolest Theater in Springfield. Hands Down." Well shucks, marquee.
Hmmm...very weird. When I took that pic, that marquee looked like this: Anybody know how I can get in touch with Judge Judy?

comments.author: Master RJ
comments.body: Veil is an anagram for evil.

comments.author: Master RJ
comments.body: You should have shown Summercamp and Protagonist.

comments.author: dan
comments.body: @Steve: indeed. The letters on the marquee were slightly altered for the GO Magazine story, and that's the only good copy I had to send to WSJ!!!

comments.author: stevie_g
comments.body: I'm just messin' with ya Dan. I thought maybe there had been some sort of rights, legal issues...whatever...that precludued the actual film titles. If I'd been serious, I would have threatened you with someone serious, like Judge Wapner.

comments.author: firehose
comments.body: by the way, the link to the WSJ article is still free as of Sunday morning!

comments.author: Ian
comments.body: The link still works!  Go Moxie!  Go customary introduction!

comments.author: Megster
comments.body: awesome!  and the link still works!  double awesome!
